Frédéric ALARCON  9, Route du Pré Mançais 76330 Notre Dame de Gravenchon - France frederic.alarcon@orange.fr +33.6.75.33.47.95   
Experience  SIBUR International - 2018 to present Technology Support Manager (France) •Introduction of new polyolefin resins into the European market •Expert coaching to R&D and production teams •Support and facilitation of relationships with polyolefin technology licensors INEOS Technologies – 2005 to 2018 Regional Licensing Manager (France) & Licensing Commercial Manager (Brussels/Lavera) •Lead negotiator for technology license contracts covering three polyolefin technologies (polyethylene & polypropylene, catalysts, technical services and technology transfer support) – typical contract income under negotiation : $ 20 to 60 million •Development of bid strategy Frédéric ALARCON  9, Route du Pré Mançais 76330 Notre Dame de Gravenchon - France frederic.alarcon@orange.fr +33.6.75.33.47.95   
Experience  SIBUR International - 2018 to present Technology Support Manager (France) •Introduction of new polyolefin resins into the European market •Expert coaching to R&D and production teams •Support and facilitation of relationships with polyolefin technology licensors INEOS Technologies – 2005 to 2018 Regional Licensing Manager (France) & Licensing Commercial Manager (Brussels/Lavera) •Lead negotiator for technology license contracts covering three polyolefin technologies (polyethylene & polypropylene, catalysts, technical services and technology transfer support) – typical contract income under negotiation : $ 20 to 60 million •Development of bid strategy for major polyolefin investments (up to 1.5 million tons production) •Market & competitor intelligence globally and regionally (ME, Russia & CIS, Europe and Americas) •Cross-functional relationship management for project strategy covering process technology, R&D , Intellectual property, legal & taxes (bid process up to 18 month) •Coordination with major EPC contractors & industry consultants •Presenter at major international conferences (IHS LAPPC & PEPP, CMR Flexpo, PO Consulting, RPTC) Key achievements •Lead negotiator for a Regional License Framework Agreement and a Joint R&D Development Agreement with the largest polymer company in the Americas (multi projects investments & multi-platforms contract) •Technology license awards for major petrochemicals projects in Mexico, Portugal, USA, Brazil & KSA  ➢3.5 million tons of licensed capacity ➢9 world scale plants  BP Chemicals - 1991 to 2005 2002 – 2005 : R&D Manager, Technical Service and Product Development (Brussels) •R&D project portfolio management •Customer segmentation and TS offer support development •Resource management & expertise development  •Intellectual property management •Key account TS management & product development partnership Key achievement •Development of a new R&D and Technical services organisation supporting three European polyethylene market segments (film, coating & Wire & Cables) and 800,000 tons of production ➢Team of 15 technologists  ➢Up to € 6.0 million direct R&D spent 
Frédéric ALARCON Seasoned Professional with Technical & Commercial International Experience Creative thinker with strong bias for actions Influential and operational at board level Productive relationship management with industry majors Immediate ability to assume technology, commercial or business development responsibilities  as individual contributor or team leader
1997 – 2002 : Licensing Product Manager  (Lavera) •Worldwide polyethylene & polypropylene product licensing offer management •Responsible for product technology performance and related contractual terms. •Competitor intelligence management •Project R&D management for licensing offer development •Promotion of new licensing product offer. Key achievement •Product expert in a major R&D partnership negotiation for the development of new resins with novel catalysts introduced into the market place Other assignments 1995 - 1997: Product Development Project Leader (Lavera) Key responsibilities ➢Lead Product Development Projects in the polyolefin sectors from initial concept to commercial production ➢Quality Control & commercialisation ➢R&D team management 1991 - 1995: Material Sciences Technologist  (Lavera) Key responsibilities: ➢Technical developments of commercial product slates ➢Material sciences program ➢Computerised material performance simulation ➢Customer support ➢Production support 1989 - 1991: Principal Scientist - Direction Générale de l’Armement (Paris) ➢Scientific studies on materials for major army development programs Education ➢Sciences Master Degree from the Ecole Nationale des Mines de Paris (ENSPM) - France ➢Material Sciences Engineer – Polytech Engineering School – Montpellier - France ➢Bilingual French - English 
Frédéric ALARCON

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
